title: InputBibliography
description: A collection of bibliographic references with optional metadata.

Classic.description: A classic work (Aristotle, Bible, etc.) with standard citation forms.

issued.description: Publication date of this edition (not original)

section.description: Section, book, or chapter in standard reference system

Collection.description: A collection of works, such as an anthology or proceedings.

CollectionComponent.description: A component of a larger monograph, such as a chapter in a book.

Contributor.description: A contributor can be a single string, a structured name, or a list of contributors.

authority.description: Legislative body conducting the hearing (e.g., "U.S. Senate Committee on Finance")

anyOf.description: A monograph, such as a book or a report, is a monolithic work published or produced as a complete entity.
A component of a larger Monograph, such as a chapter in a book. The parent monograph is referenced by its ID.
A component of a larger serial publication; for example a journal or newspaper article. The parent serial is referenced by its ID.
A collection of works, such as an anthology or proceedings.
A classic work with standard citation forms.

page.description: First page of case in reporter

title.description: Case name (e.g., "Brown v. Board of Education")

Monograph.description: A monograph, such as a book or a report, is a monolithic work published or produced as a complete entity.

MultilingualComplex.description: Complex multilingual representation with original, transliterations, and translations.

lang.description: ISO 639/BCP 47 language code for the original text.

original.description: The text in its original script.

translations.description: Translations of the text into other languages. Keys are ISO 639/BCP 47 language codes.

transliterations.description: Transliterations/Transcriptions of the original text. Keys are script codes or full BCP 47 tags.

lang.description: ISO 639/BCP 47 language code for the original name.

original.description: The name in its original script.

MultilingualString.description: A string that can be represented in multiple languages and scripts.

NumOrStr.description: A value that could be either a number or a string.

Parent_for_Collection.description: A parent reference (either embedded or by ID).

Parent_for_Serial.description: A parent reference (either embedded or by ID).

authority.description: Patent office (e.g., "U.S. Patent and Trademark Office")

SerialComponent.description: A component of a larger serial publication; for example a journal or newspaper article. The parent serial is referenced by its ID.

parent.description: The parent work, such as a magazine or journal.

SimpleName.description: A simple name is just a string, with an optional location.

StructuredName.description: A structured name is a name broken down into its constituent parts.

StructuredTitle.description: Where title parts are meaningful, use this struct; CSLN processors will not parse title strings.

Subtitle.description: The subtitle can either be a string, as is the common case, or a vector of strings.

Title.description: A title can be a single string, a structured title, or a multilingual title.

anyOf.description: A title in a single language.
A structured title in multiple languages.
